intro: Senecio weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Senecio weddellii is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
